quote: Quark.
Where's your luggage?
Back at the retrieval rack.
Aren't you going to hover over   your bags and harass my cargo   inspectors?
Not today. I wanted to give your   inspectors time to do their job.   No doubt you've got them examining   every square millimeter of each   and every one of my bags.
You're hiding something.

Oh, no I'm not.       But I know you can't take my word   for that -- so go ahead. Do what   you have to do. Go through my   luggage. Search it, scan it, tear   it apart -- in fact, why don't you   just keep it.
I never should have let her go.   Not in her condition.
Chief... I'm certain Doctor Bashir   and Major Kira are taking good   care of your wife.

And besides, you know there was no   way to keep Keiko from going.   She's been talking about the   botanical mysteries on Torad Five   for a long time. You're lucky she   agreed to limit the trip to three   days.

(shaking his head   Three days in the Gamma   Quadrant... you know what she   wanted to do last week? She   wanted to go back to Bajor and   rappel down the cliffs of Undalar   to get a fungus sample. Rappel --   to get fungus!       It's as if I have to remind her   that she's pregnant.
Yeah... I guess the extra weight,   the morning sickness, the mood   swings, the medical   examinations... they aren't   reminders enough.
I have work to do.
Rom, my brother! It's good to see   you. Come, let me pour you a   snail juice --
Okay. But only one -- my shift   starts in thirty-three minutes.
I'll make it a tall one -- and on   the house. We're celebrating.
Celebrating? What?
My return from two weeks on   Ferenginar. Didn't you miss me?
I suppose.
And I missed you. That's two   reasons to celebrate.
Enjoy.
Thanks.
Just the way you like it?
Perfect.
So, how was your trip? Did you   close the vole belly deal?
The what -- oh, yeah. Closed it   on the first day. Fifteen percent   profit margin.
Great. Did you see Moogie?
Mother's fine. She sends her   love.
What else did you do?

Well... let's see... closed the   deal. Told you that. Did some   shopping... made a pilgrimage to   the Great Marketplace... and, oh,   yes, I found out --    (directly in Rom's face    and at the top of his    lungs)   -- I'M DYING!
what are you all looking at?   Haven't you ever seen a dying man   before?
You're... dying?
I got the results of my annual   insurance physical. All the tests   came back negative... except one.   I have Dorek Syndrome.
But that's incurable.
That's right. Which explains the   dying part... and why they   canceled my policy.
But Dorek Syndrome... it's so   rare.
It strikes only one out of every   five million Ferengi.       I finally beat the odds.
How long do you have... before...
According to Doctor Orpax six   days... maybe seven.
Is he sure?
Of course he's sure -- he's one of   the most expensive doctors on   Ferenginar. He charges two strips   of latinum just to walk into the   waiting room.
This is terrible... I don't want   you to die, brother.       Maybe you should get a second   opinion. Have Doctor Bashir   examine you when he gets back from   the Gamma Quadrant.
Bashir... how good can he be? He   doesn't even charge. Besides what   could a Hew-mon doctor know about   Dorek Syndrome?
You're going to die...

That's right. And you know what   that means? We have to settle my   accounts.       That gives me six days to take   care of everything... my will...   Moogie's pension... I've got to   make funeral arrangements... pay   off my debts...
That's a lot of debts, Brother.
Yeah, but half are to   Hew-mons, Bajorans... a couple of   Klingons...
The Tholians, the Dosi, the   Romulans, the Cardassians --
Forget those. The ones I need to   pay off are the Ferengi debts.   They're the only ones that really   matter.
Rule of Acquisition seventeen: "A   contract is a contract is a   contract. But only between   Ferengi."
Exactly.       But you're right... it's still a   lot of debt.
You can always sell the desiccated   remains of your corpse on the   Ferengi Futures Exchange.
Who's going to want to buy a disk   of desiccated Quark? I'm   nobody... just some bartender   with a domineering mother and an   idiot brother.
That's not true.
Which part?
All of it. Except for the mother   part. You're more than just a   bartender. You're the first   Ferengi to make contact with the   Dominion.
I won't get any cheers for that.
You were the Grand Nagus --
For a week. If I'm lucky, I'll be   a footnote in some Ferengi   financial almanac.
You anticipated the change of   administrations here on the   station --
And as a reward, I'm inextricably   linked to the Federation. I'm a   joke back on Ferenginar.   Starfleet's favorite bartender.   The Synthehol King.       What a legacy.
You're not a joke here. You're a   respected businessman... a pillar   of the community... a man with   many friends.

Friends? Community? You sound   like some sniveling Hew-mon. The   only opinions I care about are   those of my peers -- Ferengi   businessmen. And in their eyes,   I'm a second-rate, small-time   operator... a loser.       Two days ago, I thought I had all   the time in the world to achieve   my dreams... to buy my own moon...   marry a few women... maybe even   rent some children... but now,   it's all over. I'll never be   rich...

Stop it, brother! Stop it. You   are somebody -- you'll see. You   march right over to that com-link   and offer your vacuum-desiccated   remains for sale on the Futures   Exchange. You'll see... bids will   come flooding in from all over the   Ferengi Alliance. Everyone will   want a disk of Quark on their   desk. In fact -- there may not be   enough of you to meet the demand.
You really believe that?
Yes.
You're a liar. But I love you.
Just wait... when you see how much   your body is worth -- you're going   to wish you'd died years ago.
(realizing that didn't    come out quite right)   or something like that...
Something's coming through the   wormhole.
Onscreen.
The Volga. It's been damaged.   Doctor Bashir's requesting an   emergency transport to the   Infirmary. Two patients -- Major   Kira and Keiko O'Brien.
Do it.
Go.
Keiko's in surgery -- but she's   going to be fine.
And the baby?
Oh, my god...
No, no, Chief -- the baby's fine.
You sure?
Positive. Everything's okay. The   baby's just had a... change of   address.
What?
Your son is living here now.

Kira almost had us clear of the   asteroid field, but the deflectors   got overwhelmed. We were side-   swiped by a rock the size of this   room. A fuel pod exploded and   Keiko was thrown against the   bulkhead. She had a concussion,   broken ribs, internal hemorrhaging --
I was able to stabilize her -- but   the baby's autonomic functions   were failing.       I had to find another womb for the   baby, and the only two people   available were Major Kira and...   me.
I think you made the right choice,   Doctor.
But the Major's Bajoran... how can   she carry a human child?
I had to stimulate Kira's estrogen   and progesterone production, and   administer high doses of tesokine   to enable the baby to metabolize   Bajoran nutrients.
But the bottom line is it worked,   right?
Right.
So when do you think Keiko will be   strong enough to take the baby   back?
Keiko should be up on her feet in   a day or two. However... the   baby...
What?
Major Kira will have to carry the   baby to term.
One Alvanian brandy.       Make it three.
You see, Chief... Bajoran women   carry their children for less than   five months. Because they have   such a short gestation period,   they vascularize very quickly.

Mother and child form a complex   network of interconnecting blood   vessels. To "transfer" the baby   back to Keiko, I'd have to sever   those ties, and that would likely   cause a massive internal   hemorrhage in Kira and a severe   respiratory trauma for the baby.
So what you're telling me is...   Major Kira is going to have my   baby.
Should be an interesting few   months.
What is it?
Hello, Brother. You wanted to see   me?
Come here.
Did you get lots of bids?
I wouldn't say "lots."
How many?
Let me count... ah, one.
Oh.
Seventeen bars, three strips, and   five slips of latinum for the   entire collection. It's a   generous opening bid.
It's an insultingly low offer and   it also happens to be exactly the   sum total of your life savings...
Oh. What a coincidence.
Stop it. I don't want your   charity.
It's not charity. I want to have   something to remember you by...   when you're gone.
I knew this was a mistake...
But Brother, you've got to give it   time. Your body's only been on   the Exchange for --
Oh, forget the bidding. This has   all been a mistake... my life...   coming here...

... putting a bar on this   Cardassian monstrosity of a   station... what was I thinking?       I should've followed Moogie's   advice and stayed home. I could   have made a fortune in waste   extraction like Uncle Pax.
You mean Uncle "Stinky."
You think he cares what he smells   like -- he's rich and what's more,   he's respected!
You're respected, too.
By who... Morn? A few dabo girls?
Brother come here, quick. It's a   bid.
A bid?
A huge bid.
Five hundred bars of latinum...   for the entire set.
That's ten thousand strips.
Or one million slips.
That sounds even better.
It doesn't say who the bidder is.
It's not me.
No kidding.
You think it's Moogie?
Maybe she'd buy one disk... but   all fifty-two? No... she doesn't   like me that much.       Who could it be. Who could afford   to spend five hundred bars of   latinum... on me.
Grand Nagus Zek.
The Nagus?
He used you when it suited his   needs. I don't think it's the   same thing.
Don't you see, Rom? He used me   because he likes me. He just   couldn't admit it in public. So   he made an anonymous bid as a   gesture of gratitude and   appreciation.
That doesn't sound like the Nagus   I know.       But I suppose it doesn't matter   who made the offer. The important   thing is this could stimulate   further bidding.
Now let's not be greedy, Rom. if   we wait the Nagus might change his   mind.
Going once, going twice, SOLD!
Congratulations, Brother.
It took me all my life, but I'm   going to die a winner.
Hi.
How you feeling?
Like I was hit by a ten ton rock.       Julian says I'll be on my feet   tomorrow. How are you?
Fine.       Though I think I've put on a   little weight.
You carry it well.
You know... what you're doing for   me... for us... I don't know how   to thank you.
Go ahead. Touch it.
You sure?
It's your baby, Keiko.
... that'll pay off Moogie, leaving   one hundred and ninety-six bars to   pay off Uncle Gorad and Cousin   Gaila. Is that clear?
I think so...
Good. Now on to my funeral   arrangements.
That makes me sad, Brother.
Now, now. None of that. My death   is nothing to get upset about --   I'm making money on it.
First, I want my eulogy to take   place in the holosuite. We'll   charge admission. Two slips a   head.
I don't know about that...
You're right, make it three. I   want you to use this program --   it's Doctor Bashir's.
Roman chariot races?
Trust me, it's spectacular. Big   crowds. Lots of cheering. Tell   all the women -- especially Dax --   they have to come naked... out of   respect.
Quark... I just got an odd message   from a Doctor Orpax on Ferenginar.
He wanted me to tell you: he's   very sorry. You don't have Dorek   Syndrome. Does that make any   sense to you?
You don't have Dorek Syndrome...
You know what that means, Rom?
It means you're going to live!
It means I get to sue Doctor Orpax   for malpractice.       And I'm going to live!
Were you sick?
See why I don't go to Hew-mon   doctors? He couldn't even tell I   was sick.
But you weren't sick.
He couldn't tell that either.
I don't have time for this. If   you want a physical, you know   where to find me.
Come, Brother. Let's celebrate.
Celebrate? We have work to do!
We do?
Rom, you idiot, we just spent   seven hours selling off my assets   and paying my debts. We have to   undo all that.       Now, rescind the debt payments to   Moogie, Uncle Gorad and Cousin   Gaila.
I'm coming. I'm coming.
Computer. Lights.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Come in already.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Brunt. F.C.A.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Don't tell me, this is a surprise   audit.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Not this time.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm here to check on my   merchandise.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: What are you talking about?
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm talking about you. I paid   five hundred bars of latinum for   your desiccated remains and I'm   here to collect.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You're the anonymous buyer?
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Who did you expect? The Nagus?
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: The Nagus? Of course not. I'm   just a little surprised it was   you. I guess you haven't heard   the news.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You mean that you don't have Dorek   Syndrome? I know all about it.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But then... I don't understand.   What are you doing here?
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm here to get what I paid for.   The contract called for fifty-two   disks of vacuum-desiccated Quark   available within six days. I'm   here to make sure you deliver the   merchandise.
scene: 17   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Maybe I wasn't clear... I'm not   dying.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Maybe I wasn't clear... I don't   care. I want my merchandise. I   have a thousand ideas on how to   defile your remains... want to   hear my favorites?
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Oh, I see. How foolish of me --   I forgot to mention, that on top   of your full refund, you'll also   be receiving an additional five   bars of latinum for your troubles.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Did I say five? I meant ten.       You drive a hard bargain. Twelve.   And that's my final offer.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Well, not my final-final offer...   twenty bars.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Look, it's late. You've come a   long way...
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Why don't we stop this haggling   and you just tell me how much you   want.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But I'm not going to die just yet!   What do you expect me to do --   kill myself?
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Of course not.    (off Quark's look of    hope)   You can have someone do it for   you. I recommend strangulation...   it leaves the body relatively   unmarked for desiccation.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You can't be serious?
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: A contract is a contract --
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: -- is a contract. I know that!   But you don't collect on contracts   under these circumstances -- we're   not Klingons! We're businessmen.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: This isn't business, Quark. This   is personal.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But... why? What have I ever done   to you?
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Done to me?       And you call your brother an   idiot? Nothing you've ever done   to me has been more than a minor   inconvenience.       No... protecting your mother from   an F.C.A. audit, and secretly   settling with your striking   employees were merely symptoms of   a much more vile and insidious   weakness. A weakness that makes   me loath you... not for what   you've done but for who you are...   what you are.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: A bartender?
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: A philanthropist.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I am not!
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You give your customers credit at   the bar... you only take a thirty   percent kickback from your   employees' tips and --       -- you sold food and medicine to   Bajoran refugees at cost.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: That's not true -- it was just   above cost.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Close enough. It was still a   generous, humanitarian gesture.       You've gone Starfleet -- you might   as well be wearing one of their   uniforms.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: It's people like you that give   honest Ferengi businessmen a bad   name.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I can reform. I'll start gouging   the customers again. I'll revoke   all my employees' vacation time...
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I didn't give them anything   they contributed to a central fund   which I manage and --
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You disgust me.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Look, I understand your anger.   You're absolutely right about   me... but there must be some   accommodation we can make...   something other than me killing   myself.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Of course there is. You can break   the contract.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Me? Break a Ferengi contract?   Never.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Never? I wonder if there's enough   Ferengi left in you to stick to   that. Part of me hopes you will   break it...
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: ... because then -- everything you   and your family own on Ferenginar   will be confiscated and sold to   the lowest bidder... your mother   will be forced to live in the   streets, begging for scraps of   food... and of course, no Ferengi   will do business with you, or even   talk to you. You'll be cut off   from all contact with your own   people.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But I like Ferengi. I feel   comfortable around them.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Well we don't feel comfortable   around you. You're a disease, Quark,   a festering tumor on the lobes of   Ferengi society. And it's my job   to cut you off.
scene: 18   INT. QUARK'S QUARTERS - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: That's it... one step at a time.
We're almost there. Prepare for   docking. Thrusters back to half.
Nice landing, Captain. Let me   know when you want to get underway   again.
I think I'll sit here for a week.
Did you see Kira today?
Saw her in Ops.
I was thinking of inviting her to   dinner.
Good idea. Maybe she could come   every night.
Even if she came every night... it   wouldn't be enough.
I know I'm being selfish... I   should be grateful that my baby is   alive and well... but I shouldn't   have to make appointments to be   with my own child.
What are we going to do, Miles?
I don't know...
It's not that noticeable.
Maybe not now. But just wait.   Julian showed me a picture of a   human mother just before she gave
Whoa.
Are you all right?
I think it... kicked.
You don't have to do anything.   It's my understanding the child   will kick and move periodically...
It did it again.
Odo... I'm pregnant.
Yes.
I mean I knew I was... but... this   is amazing.
Kira to Keiko O'Brien. The baby's   kicking. Can you come?
I'm not supposed to leave my   quarters. Julian --
It's okay, I'll come to you.
Oh, what the hell. Kira to Ops.   Emergency transport. Beam me   directly to the O'Briens'   quarters.       Don't mention this to the captain.
I wasn't even here.

I know what you're thinking,   brother: That you can't break a   sacred Ferengi tradition. But the   truth is... defying Ferengi   tradition isn't so bad. I did it.   I formed a union. Everyone said   I was crazy... that no Ferengi   would have anything to do with me.
They didn't want anything to do   with you before you formed the   union...
-- try on the trousers first.   I've added extra padding to the   seat -- you should find swiveling   on a barstool much more   comfortable.
I'm afraid your pants won't be   ready 'til next week, Quark.
That's not why I'm here.
Oh? Then what can I do for you?
I want to hire you. Not as a   tailor... as an assassin.
I don't know what you're talking   about.
Oh, yes you do. You weren't   always a tailor.
You're right. I used to be a   gardener. Now, if you have   something you want weeded, you let   me know.
Not something... someone.
You're going to have Brunt killed?   I didn't think you had it in you,   brother. What a bold,   uncompromising move.
Would you be quiet?
I don't want you to kill Brunt...   I want you to kill me.
You want me to kill you? Well,   that's different...
Something swift and painless,   preferably bloodless, though I   imagine that's not always   possible.
Wait a minute -- you can't do   this. I thought you were going to   break the contract.
What are the key words there?   "You thought"...
But brother --
Don't "brother" me, Rom. I'm not   like you... or Nog or Moogie or   the rest of our pathetic family.   I'm a Ferengi businessman and I   made a contract. And a contract   is a --
Don't quote the Rules of   Acquisition to me. This is your   life we're talking about.
That's right -- my life. And   what's the most important thing in   my life?
Business?
That's who I am... that's what I   do. I'm a businessman. And more   than that, I'm a Ferengi   businessman.

Do you know what that means? it   means that I'm not exploiting and   cheating people at random. I'm   doing it according to a specific   set of rules. The Rules of   Acquisition. And I won't   disregard them when I find them   inconvenient.
Inconvenient? Brother, you're   going to die.

Yes. And when I arrive at the   gates of the Divine Treasury, the   Registrar will accept my bribe and   usher me inside... and you know   why? Because I died exactly the   way I lived -- as a Ferengi.
Garak. Let's talk about death...
He's kicking so hard, you think   he's all right?
It's a good sign. I thought Molly   was going to kick her way out of   me.
The lower back, right?
Hold on -- I've got just the   thing.
It was very thoughtful of you to   share this with us. Thanks,   major.
Please, Nerys.
Any morning sickness?
What's that?
Well, I don't know how it is for   Bajorans... but human mothers   typically wake up feeling   nauseous.
It doesn't work that way with   Bajorans... typically, we start   sneezing. Uncontrollably. But   this is a human child... so I   don't know what to expect.
Better?
Mommy, I'm hungry.
It is about that time. I'll get   dinner started.
And I should get back to my   quarters.
Why? Have dinner with us.
I don't want to impose.
Nerys. You're having our child   you're family now.
That's right. In fact, Keiko and   I have been talking about   something... we have an idea we'd   like you to consider.
It's just an idea... we don't want   to pressure you.
I understand. What is it?
How's that?
Awful. Did you hear that sound of   bone snapping? I don't want that   to be the last thing I hear.
It wasn't that loud...
You don't have these ears.   Snapping vertebrae is out.

We're running out of options,   Quark. You don't want to be   vaporized because you need a   body... the disruptor ruined your   clothes... a knife was too   savage... the nerve gas smelled   bad... hanging took too long, and   poison... what was wrong with   poison?
It won't work. If I know my food   is poisoned, I won't eat it.
Can you get rid of that? The   sight of it makes me sick.
Computer. Remove corpse.
For a man who wants to kill   himself, you seem strangely   determined to live.

I am going to die -- don't you   worry about that. I just want to   find the right way. I don't want   to see it coming... or hear it...   or smell it... or feel it. I just   want to go on with my life until --      -- I'm dead.
You want to be surprised.
Exactly. I want to wake up in the   Divine Treasury and have no idea   how I got there.
I see. Perhaps that can be   arranged.
Really, how?
If I tell you, it won't be much of   a surprise. Will it?
That's true. All right. I leave   it up to you.
You have my word... you'll never   know what hit you.
Computer. End program.
Computer -- lights.
Garak, if you're here... I'm not   going to be surprised.
Where am I?
"Please have your profit and loss   statements ready for inspection   before entering the... Divine   Treasury."       I'm dead. Garak... you're good.
I'm really dead...
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You're not just dead, Quark...   you're an idiot.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Who are you?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I am Gint. The First Grand Nagus.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You look like... like my brother,   Rom.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: That's because this is a dream,   you imbecile.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: So, I'm not dead...
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: What a clever boy... always   thinking.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm asleep. That explains why   this place looks so tacky. I   mean...       The Divine Treasury? Please.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Don't blame me for your limited   imagination. Now, I'll make it   simple. You have to break the   contract with Brunt.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You gotta be joking. You're Gint.   You wrote the Rules of   Acquisition. The sacred precepts   upon which all Ferengi society is   based. You can't really expect me   to break them.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Why not? They're just rules...   they're written in a book, not   carved in stone. And even if they   were in stone, so what? A bunch   of us just made them up.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Are you saying they don't matter?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Of course they matter. That's why   they're a best-seller... but we're   talking about your life here. The   Rules are nothing but guideposts,   suggestions...
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Then why call them Rules?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Would you buy a book called   "Suggestions of Acquisition"?   Doesn't quite have the same ring   to it, does it?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: You mean it was a marketing ploy?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: A brilliant one... Rule of   Acquisition two hundred thirty-   nine: "Never be afraid to mislabel   a product."
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I've built my entire life around   these rules. How can I just walk   away from them?
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Because I'm telling you to.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But you can't do that -- you're   not Gint... this is just a dream.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Exactly. And I wouldn't be here   if you didn't want to break the   Rules. You just need someone's   permission. So I'm giving it to   you.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I suppose if First Nagus Gint came   to me in a vision, and told me to   break the Rules... that would be   all right.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Hold it right there.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Brunt... F.C.A.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: What are you doing here? This is   a private vision.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm here to remind you of the   consequences of disregarding the   Rules. Poverty, destitution,   exile...
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I know, I know. But look -- Gint   himself has come to me in a   vision. He's telling me to break   the contract.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: That is not Gint. Gint was a lot   taller.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Listen to that fraud and you'll   regret it for the rest of your   miserable life.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I say we kill him, right now.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: This is a dream. You can't kill   me.    (standing up and moving    over to Quark,    menacingly)   However, people have been known to   die in their sleep.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Come on Rom... Gint... whatever   your name is -- help me!
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: He's got a point, Quark. It's a   dream... I can't really do   anything.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: He's got a point, Quark. It's a   dream... I can't really do   anything.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: But if you want to live --
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: Break the contract... it's your   only hope.
scene: 31   INT. DIVINE TREASURY - WAITING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm alive...
I find it surprising that someone   with such long, slender and nimble   fingers has never practiced oo-mox.
Come to beg for your life?
What is this?
I'm returning your five hundred   bars of latinum. Plus interest.
I told you I wasn't interested in   a refund.
I know. I'm breaking the   contract.
I knew it. You're just like the   rest of your family... weak-lobed   degenerates. Another loser in a   long line of failed Ferengis.

Look, I've broken the contract so   do your job -- take my assets,   revoke my Ferengi business   license... do whatever you have to   do, then get out. And if I ever   see you walk into my bar again...
Yes?
You won't walk out.
Your attention, please.
Brunt... F.C.A. As of this   moment, no further Ferengi   commerce may be conducted in this   bar...
... no Ferengi may be employed in   this bar... no Ferengi may eat or   drink in this bar... and no   Ferengi may do business with --    (pointing an accusatory    finger)   -- that man.
The confiscation of assets will   begin immediately.
Ladies and gentlemen, the bar is   closed until further notice.   Thank you for your patronage...
I'll take that, maj-- Nerys.       Is this it?
I travel light.
Would you like to see your room?
Sure.
Welcome to your new home.
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: At least until the baby's born.
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Are you my aunt?
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: (looking at the O'Briens    for help)   Well...
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Sounds right to me.
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Aunt Nerys.
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Aunt Nerys, can I play in your   room?
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Aunt Nerys, can I play in your   room?
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: Any time.
scene: 37   INT. O'BRIENS' QUARTERS - KIRA'S NEW BEDROOM

quote: How are you, Brother?
How am I? I'm broke. Ruined.   Destitute. A pariah.       How are things with you?
Not bad.
Glad to hear it.
They took everything?
Including this shirt. I'm   supposed to send it to Brunt in   the morning.
Don't worry. I have some old   clothes I was going to throw out.
I'd rather be naked.
Oh. Well, then I guess throwing   my entire life away was worth it.
I wouldn't go that far.       So, what are you going to do now?
Well, Rom... I've been thinking   Long and hard. And you know what?       I don't have a clue.
Quark, where do you want this?
What is it?
A case of Alvanian brandy.
A patient sent it to me as   payment. But I can't accept it.
Nice try, Doctor. But I don't   want your charity.
It's not charity. I find this   undrinkable. Now do you want it   or should I dump it?
Quark.
My sister sent me these. I   thought you might want them.   They're really ugly.
They're not as ugly as the old   ones, but they're pretty bad.
This is all very amusing, but I   can't start a bar with a case of   bad brandy and a set of ugly   glasses.
Quark!
Yes, captain?
We're doing some structural repair   work on level two of the Habitat   Ring. We need a place to store   some extra furniture for the next   few months and it looks like you   have the room...
Where would you like this,   Captain?
There are three levels, Constable.   Use them all.
Understood.
Captain -- you can't do this!
Not without paying a storage fee.       A minimal storage fee.   Practically nothing.
Send me a bill.
All right.       Well, don't just stand there, Odo.   Move it all in.
Look at them, brother. And you   thought you had no assets.
Sisko... Bashir... Dax... Morn...   they're my assets?
To name a few.
I guess you're right...
I need a drink.
